data.title: Check out all the player bios on the Grand Rapids Drive
data.meta_description: A number of players with NBA experience on the first-year NBA D-League team.
data.text:
GRAND RAPIDS, MI - Here is a look at the current Grand Rapids Drive roster ahead of Thursday's home opener. Only 10 players will be active for the game.

Position:

Guard

Size:

6-3, 206

Colleges:

Notre Dame, Mississippi State

Born:

12-23-87

NOTABLE: Has played 28 games in the NBA … Signed with the Indiana Pacers as an undrafted free agent on Sept. 18, 2012 out of Notre Dame … During his rookie season in the NBA, the guard made 28 appearances for the Indiana Pacers … Brother Tyler Hansbrough was a three-time All-American basketball standout at the University of North Carolina and current member of the Toronto Raptors.

Position:

Guard

Size:

6-4, 210

College:

Wake Forest

Born:

5-8-88

NOTABLE: Undrafted in 2010 … Played four games with the San Antonio Spurs in NBA Summer League in 2012 … Played the past three seasons (2010-14) with the Springfield Armor of the NBA Development League and averaged 6.6 points in 30 games.

Position: Forward

Size: 6-6, 232

College: Memphis

Born: 5-25-93

NOTABLE: Has played six games for two NBA teams … After going undrafted in 2013, joined the Atlanta Hawks for the 2013 NBA Summer League. … On Feb. 25, 2014, Thomas signed a 10-day contract with the Orlando Magic where he played in four games and had seven points and three rebounds. On March 7, he signed a second 10-day contract with the Magic … On April 7, 2014, he signed a 10-day contract with the Philadelphia 76ers where he played in two games - including one start - shooting 3-of-5 from the field and finished with seven points and an assist.

Position:

Guard

Size:

6-5, 200

Colleges:

Purdue and Illinois-Chicago

Born:

6-1-88

NOTABLE: Went undrafted in 2012 … Played his first three years of college ball at Purdue University (2009-12) before transferring to Illinois-Chicago for his senior year (2013-14) … Played in 93 games with the Boilermakers, averaging 5.4 points and 2.9 rebounds.

Position:

Guard

Size:

6-5, 189

College:

North Carolina State

Born:

8-26-90

NOTABLE: Has played in 26 NBA games … Drafted in the second round of the 2013 NBA Draft by the Minnesota Timberwolves (52nd overall) … Played 26 games with the 76ers in 2013-14, scoring 64 points (2.5 points per game). He had 13 steals, 28 rebounds and 41 assists … Played 20 games in the D-League last season, 12 with the Delaware 87ers and eight with the Springfield Armor and averaged 17.3 points, 6.3 points and 4.5 rebounds per game.

Position:

Guard

Size:

6-8, 230

College:

Georgia Tech

Born:

6-14-85

NOTABLE: Went undrafted after a four-year career at Georgia Tech in 2012 … Played professionally in South American this summer … At Georgia Tech, he was one of the ACC's top sixth men during his final two seasons after starting all 31 games as a sophomore.

Position:

Guard

Size:

6-4, 195

College:

Nevada

Born:

8-13-88

NOTABLE: Went undrafted in 2010 … Played overseas in Romania, Morocco and Hungary … Attended the University of Nevada from 2006-2010 where he started 67 of his 133 career games. His senior year, he averaged a career-high 14.5 points and 2.4 assists per game.

Position: Forward

Size: 6-5, 230

College: Findlay

Born: 5-12-87

NOTABLE: Has played professionally for six years … Went undrafted in 2009 … Has played with Kyoto Hannaryz in Japan (2009-10), Liège Basket in Belgium (2011-12), Élan Chalon in France (2013), and last season for Spartak in Saint Petersburg, Russia (2013-14) … On Nov. 1, 2010, Bostic was selected by the New Mexico Thunderbirds in the third round of the 2010 NBA D-League Draft and played in 48 games, averaging 12.4 points, 4.6 rebounds … At Division II Findlay in Ohio, Bostic was named the 2008-09 NCAA Division II Player of the Year.

Position:

Forward

Size:

6-9, 225

Colleges:

Tennesse, USC

Born:

5-4-89

NOTABLE: Went undrafted after a five-year college career that began at Tennessee and ended at USC in 2013. … Played with the Los Angeles Lakers in the 2013 NBA Summer League … Played with Bilbao Basket of Spain in the fall of 2013 … Jan. 24, 2014, he signed with Metalac Valjevo of Serbia for the rest of the 2013–14 season … Father Orlando Woolridge played collegiately at Notre Dame where he earned All-America honors before a 13-year NBA career (1981-94), mostly with the Chicago Bulls, Los Angeles Lakers and Detroit Pistons.

Position:

Center

Size:

6-10, 220

College:

Saint Louis University

Born:

5-16-90

NOTABLE: Just signed with the team on Friday … Was in camp with the Brooklyn Nets and played two seasons with the Springfield Armor in the D-League … Averaged 14.8 points and 10.1 rebounds with the Armor last season … In 2012-13, earned Honorable Mention All-Development League Team honors after averaging 14.8 points and 7.8 rebounds per game with Springfield.

Position:

Center

Size:

7-3, 270

College:

Connecticut

Born:

2-16-87

NOTABLE: Has played in 224 NBA games over five seasons … Was the No. 2 overall pick in 2009 NBA Draft by the Memphis Grizzlies, becoming the first Tanzanian-born NBA player … Has played in the NBA with Memphis, Oklahoma City Thunder, Portland Trail Blazers and Houston Rockets … In 2013-14 with the Thunder, played in 23 games and averaged 1.2 points and 1.7 rebounds in 8.4 minutes in 56 games … In college, he was a two-time winner of the National Association of Basketball Coaches National Defensive Player of the Year Award in 2008 and 2009.
